ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned lots of new grammar and vocabulary.

I greatly improved my Korean speaking, writing, and reading abilities during this course. Professor Kim was the best language teacher I've ever had and incredibly caring, funny, and helpful. I am much more fluent and knowledgeable of Korean after taking this course.
Korean grammar and culture
Speaking, Reading, and Writing skills in Korean.
I learned a lot about the grammar of Korean sentence formation and vocabulary.
This class taught the Korean language in a very aporoachable way, placing it in context to the various situations we may have had to use the language.
better speaking and listening

We learned a lot of nee korean grammar structures and got a lot of practice in implementing them and improving our korean speaking. A part of the verbal training took the form of being able to make presentations and speeches in korean to present to an audience.
My writing and speaking level greatly improved this semester because of this course, and I have a deeper appreciation and understanding for Korean culture

I greatly improved my Korean language skills in reading, writing, and grammar. I also became more accustomed to Korean culture through the familial-like community in the class fostered by the teacher and students.

Presentation Skills 
What it means to be Korean American

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was extremely well organized. Everybody was aware of the expectations on assignments and projects, which removed a lot of the stress induced by the disorganized nature of some professors in the Korean department. There was definitely an emphasis on writing short essays which I appreciated.
Very neat and detailed presentations each class explaining grammar and vocab. Great inclusion of student projects and discussions as well as practice. Always felt prepared for the tests!
Learning Korean with other heritage learners is so meaningful and empowering
No weaknesses! I really enjoyed this course.
The class was highly engaging and made learnimg an enjoyable experience. Working with classmates allowed us to develop our skills in a natural manner.
teacher always aaliable to help, connect with modern Korean culture

The instructor and the classroom environment she created was incredible! Nobody felt embarrassed to speak up with their opinions or thoughts and it was truly special. 


The presentation based projects were extremely beneficial in improving not only our hard korean skills but also our confidence in speaking and presenting in korean. 

I felt the class found a balance between a structured textbook curriculum to ensure there were no gaps in our formal knowledge of the korean language, with a more personal-interested-directed project structure of the assignments. 

There were virtually no weaknesses in this class. I truly feel like I am a better at speaking, reading, and writing in the korean language

The strengths of this course was its organization and structure; I think the weaknesses was that there could have been more material on Korean etiquette and culture, and relevant language in the workplace and for other formal address.
The greatest strength of the class was the immersive environment and the community that made learning and speaking Korean much more comfortable.

In a course designed for native speakers, the presentation of course content felt too rigid and structured since the class goes by the textbook. However, at times when the content was flexible, the students in the class made the class interesting.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. KREN 142 has been the highlight of my Yale experience thus far. I've successfully been able to improve my Korean writing abilities drastically and been able to form many meaningful connections with those in the class. I truly believe that both the relationships I've formed and the things I've learned in the class will carry along with me for a long time and I am incredibly grateful to have been able to have had such a wonderful experience.
Yes!! Definitely take this course, it is one of the best language courses at Yale!
Yes
YES!
Yes, this class was a great experience and I was able to see my development in my skills clearly.
yes!
100% especially if youre lucky enough to have it with Ms. Hyeseong Kim. Shes so lovely and as the class meets every day, the class makes me start the day feeling happy and productive.

Absolutely, I felt that this was a course that was so fun I barely felt like it was work, even though I learned so much more than I did in the previous semester's more intensive class. My Korean class is very close and we have developed a Korean community from taking this course, and we are also extremely close to our instructor and very much adore her.
Yes I would, for anyone that wants to learn Korean.
Yes, I would highly recommend this class to native speakers because of the friendships formed from this class.
